item.title: Meadow add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I've gone to prepare a place for you But I will come back again." -- Anonymous

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love." -- Anonymous

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You know, you could live a thousand lifetimes and not deserve him." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing." -- Rick Riordan

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Remember, we're madly in love, so it's all right to kiss me anytime you feel like it." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Meadow add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Meadow add a quote by George Lucas
item.description: "So this is how liberty dies. With thunderous applause." -- George Lucas

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Carolyn Keene
item.description: "Do act mysterious. It always keeps them coming back for more." -- Carolyn Keene

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant filled with odd little waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "Excellent!" I cried. "Elementary," said he." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Meadow add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "People aren't either wicked or noble. They're like chef's salads, with good things and bad things chopped and mixed together in a vinaigrette of confusion and conflict." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "A Penny Saved is a Penny Earned" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Meadow add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "To the glistening eastern sea, I give you Queen Lucy the Valiant. To the great western woods, King Edmund the Just. To the radiant southern sun, Queen Susan the Gentle. And to the clear northern skies, I give you King Peter the Magnificent. Once a king or queen of Narnia, always a king or queen of Narnia. May your wisdom grace us until the stars rain down from the heavens." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Meadow add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It isn't Narnia, you know," sobbed Lucy. "It's you. We shan't meet you there. And how can we live, never meeting you?" "But you shall meet me, dear one," said Aslan. "Are -are you there too, Sir?" said Edmund. "I am," said Aslan. "But there I have another name. You must learn to know me by that name. This was the very reason why you were brought to Narnia, that by knowing me here for a little, you may know me better there." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Meadow add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "That's the worst of girls," said Edmund to Peter and the Dwarf. "They never can carry a map in their heads." "That's because our heads have something inside them," said Lucy." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Kirk Cameron
item.description: "There is nothing more important than your eternal salvation." -- Kirk Cameron

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Do you know what breakfast cereal is made of? It's made of all those little curly wooden shavings you find in pencil sharpeners!" -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Meadow add a quote by N.D. Wilson
item.description: "Stealing ideas from contemporaries is rude and tasteless. Stealing from the long dead is considered literary and admirable. The same is true of grave-robbing. Loot your local cemetery and find yourself mired in social awkwardness. But unearth the tomb of an ancient king and you can feel free to pop off his toe rings. You'll probably end up on a book tour, or bagging an honorary degree or two." -- N.D. Wilson

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Victor Hugo
Meadow add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Happy Hunger Games! And may the odds be ever in your favor." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Meadow add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You here to finish me off, Sweetheart?" -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Meadow add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie
